page.title: 14FARMING IN 1985
page.content: 1being kept warm and by effluent being added. It is left until it is pickled and is then stored for winter. The grass is very long and has a lot of fertilizer spread on it before it starts to grow. The hay is much the same, but when cut it is left to dry and is then bailed. This is used for bedding. The cows are brought in in about November and put out again around March or April depending on how dry the fields are. When breeding, they put the cow with a bull. The bull does its duty and after about 8 weeks the calf is born. After 3 weeks they are separated. The cow is milked and it goes back to the field. The calf is put with the other calves and is usually sold at auction, unless the farmer wishes to enlarge his herd. When the corn is ready for harvesting
